text: Dominique Dropsy (9 December 1951 – 7 October 2015) was a French footballer. He played as a goalkeeper. He earned seventeen international caps for the French national team during the late 1970s, early 1980s. He was a player of RC Strasbourg (1973–1984), he was a member of the French team in the 1978 FIFA World Cup. He played in a total of 596 Ligue 1 matches between 1972-1989, a record at that time. Dropsy died in Leuze, France from leukemia, aged 63. ==Other websites== * French Football Federation Profile * Profile Category:1951 births Category:2015 deaths Category:1978 FIFA World Cup players Category:Footballers from Hauts-de-France Category:French association football goalkeepers Category:People from Aisne
title: Dominique Dropsy
